{{Infobox football biography |name = Connor Ronan |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Connor Patrick Ronan{{cite web|title=Retained List 2016-17|url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-released-and-retained-list---2016-17.pdf|publisher=English Football League|format=PDF|accessdate=13 June 2017}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|3|6|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Rochdale]], England |height = 1.78 m{{cite web |title=Connor Ronan |publisher=Walsall F.C. |accessdate=7 December 2018 |url= https://www.saddlers.co.uk/teams/first-team/midfielder/connor-ronan/}} |position = [[Midfielder]] |currentclub = [[FC DAC 1904 Dunajská Streda|Dunajská Streda]]
(on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]) |clubnumber = 27 |youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2009 |youthclubs1 = Copperpot J.F.C. |youthyears2 = 2009–2014 |youthclubs2 = [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] |youthyears3 = 2014–2016 |youthclubs3 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] |years1 = 2016– |clubs1 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] |caps1 = 7 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2018 |clubs2 = → [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] (loan) |caps2 = 16 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2018–2019 |clubs3 = → [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] (loan) |caps3 = 11 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2019 |clubs4 = → [[FC DAC 1904 Dunajská Streda|Dunajská Streda]] (loan) |caps4 = 0 |goals4 = 0 |nationalyears1 = 2015 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps1 = 2 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2015 |nationalteam2 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-17 football team|Republic of Ireland U17]] |nationalcaps2 = 5 |nationalgoals2 = 1 |nationalyears3 = 2015–2017 |nationalteam3 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team|Republic of Ireland U19]] |nationalcaps3 = 8 |nationalgoals3 = 1 |nationalyears4 = 2017– |nationalteam4 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-21 football team|Republic of Ireland U21]] |nationalcaps4 = 2 |nationalgoals4 = 0 |club-update = 15 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Connor Patrick Ronan''' (born 6 March 1998) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[FC DAC 1904 Dunajská Streda]], on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. He was born in England, but represents Republic of Ireland at international youth level. ==Career== Ronan started his career by Copperpot J.F.C.[https://www.rochdaleonline.co.uk/sites/copperpot-jfc/under-11s-win-bowlee-tournament The semi was a more open game and Copperpot stormed to a 2 goal lead through Connor Ronan and Sam Astin to progress.] and attended [[St Cuthbert's RC High School]] in [[Rochdale]] with whom he reached the final of the English National Schools Cup as a year 7 in 2009 with a team that also included [[Axel Tuanzebe]], Kisimba Kisimba and [[Johny Diba]], who all went on to become pros.http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-youngster-axel-tuanzebe-10396435 He then joined [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]], his boyhood club in which he stayed there until he joined [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] at the age of 16.{{cite news|title=Five Things We Have Learned About Connor Ronan|url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/five-things-we-have-learned-about-connor-ronan-2279740.aspx|work=[[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.]]|publisher=EFL Digital Limited|date=2 February 2015|accessdate=17 December 2016}} Ronan made three appearances for the team's [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. Development Squad and Academy|development squad]] in the [[2016–17 EFL Trophy]], scoring a goal in their 4–0 win over [[EFL League Two]] team [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]].{{cite news|title=Youngsters Make Progress In Cup|url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/report-youngsters-make-progress-in-cup-3406677.aspx|work=[[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.]]|publisher=EFL Digital Limited|date=8 November 2016|accessdate=17 December 2016}} With [[Paul Lambert]] as manager, Ronan was part of the first-team squad for the first time on 26 November 2016,{{cite news|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2016/11/26/wolves-vs-sheffield-wednesday-live/|title=Wolves 0 Sheffield Wednesday 2 - As it happened|date=26 November 2016|accessdate=17 December 2016|work=[[Express & Star]]|publisher=[[MNA Media]]}} as an unused substitute in the 2–0 defeat to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]]. Ronan made his debut on 17 December 2016, replacing [[Hélder Costa (footballer)|Hélder Costa]] for the final nine minutes of the team's 2–0 win over [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38271717|title=Nottingham Forest 0-2 Wolverhampton Wanderers|date=17 December 2016|accessdate=17 December 2016|work=[[BBC Sport]]|publisher=[[BBC]]}}{{cite news|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2016/12/17/nottingham-forest-0-wolves-2-report/soccer-sky-bet-championship-nottingham-forest-v-wolverhampton-wanderers-41/|title=Nottingham Forest 0 Wolves 2 - Report and pictures|date=17 December 2016|accessdate=17 December 2016|work=[[Express & Star]]|publisher=[[MNA Media]]|quote=Lambert did too. He sent on youngster Connor Ronan for his professional debut in place of Costa.}} On 31 August 2018, Ronan joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on loan until January 2019 along with team-mate Connor Johnson.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45375788 |title=Connor Johnson and Connor Ronan: Wolves duo join Walsall on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 August 2018 |accessdate=1 September 2018 }} Ronan returned to Wolves at the conclusion of his loan spell, making 15 appearances in all competitions for Walsall.{{cite web|url=https://www.saddlers.co.uk/news/2019/january/ronan-returns-to-wolves|title=Ronan Returns to Wolves|publisher=Walsall F.C.|date=2 January 2019}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 1 January 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="4"|[[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] |[[2016–17 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2016–17]]{{soccerbase season|87731|2016|accessdate=2 September 2017}} |[[EFL Championship|Championship]] |4||0||2||0||0||0||3Appearances in the [[EFL Trophy]] with [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. Development Squad and Academy|Wolverhampton Wanderers U23s]]||1||9||1 |- |[[2017–18 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2017–18]]{{soccerbase season|87731|2017|accessdate=2 September 2017}} |Championship |3||0||0||0||4||0||colspan="2|—||7||0 |- |[[2018–19 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2018–19]]{{soccerbase season|87731|2018|accessdate=6 October 2018}} |[[Premier League]] |0||0||0||0||0||0||colspan="2|—||0||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !7!!0!!2!!0!!4!!0!!3!!1!!16!!1 |- |[[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Portsmouth F.C. season|2017–18]] |[[EFL League One|League One]] |16||0||0||0||0||0||1Appearance in the [[EFL Trophy]]||0||17||0 |- |[[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Walsall F.C. season|2018–19]] |League One |11||0||0||0||0||0||4||0||15||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !34!!0!!2!!0!!4!!0!!8!!1!!48!!1 |} {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Soccerbase}} *{{Soccerway}} {{FC DAC 1904 Dunajská Streda squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ronan, Connor}} [[Category:1998 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Rochdale]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:Republic of Ireland association footballers]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:English people of Irish descent]] [[Category:England youth international footballers]] [[Category:Republic of Ireland youth international footballers]] [[Category:Rochdale A.F.C. players]] [[Category:Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. players]] [[Category:Portsmouth F.C. players]] [[Category:Walsall F.C. players]] [[Category:FC DAC 1904 Dunajská Streda players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Slovakia]]
